reviews.review_msg: Amazing! Great class that actually made statistics look like something other than gibberish. If it's a required course take the pre-req the semester before you take this and the class will make sense. SPSS finally makes some sense!
Great professor. Very nice person and very helpful. Highly recommended.
I thought it was a good class...
Terrific class... reading load is a bit heavy at times but the articles are interesting.  take his class!

His use of a caim voice is a facade used for conformity. This is a self righteous jerk, same thing for the TAs he selects. an intellectual know it all. its not inspiring work. and the class is training and not an education or freedom of thought. It Makes me regret transferring to SFU. This was Not a useful class.

His lecture notes are completely useless. His amount of criteria needed to explain his assignments are so brief that I practically lost marks on areas that I didn't know I would've lost. I followed what the criteria asked me to do but he still deducted my marks on many areas. What a jerk...Also, his TA's are pathetic too. Not helpful and mean!!!

Very anal in marking!!  His marking scale was unfair because he nitpicks every single tiny detail while his TAs mark so much easier.  He also requires you to think outside the box by A WHOLE LOT, normally in research proposals, you follow all the criteria/guidelines provided. However, you are required to think of every single tiny detail outside th

The course material was all over the place during the semester, poor coordinated. The text book was dry and hard to read, and there was a lot of reading assigned. He went off topic A LOT and talked about his own research and that of his wife. He was very reluctant in helping me and asked i speak with the TA's instead. Personally, I couldn't underst
The guy knows his stuff! awesome!

He teaches what can only be referred to as a gentleman's class. This quality is so hard to find sometimes, as it requires a genuine interest in the subject and a wish for students to succeed by the teacher.
Quiet, but friendly. Available for help outside of classes, and gives useful advice. Managed to make boring subject matter somewhat entertaining.
He's so cute, I just want to pinch him! He is smart and a great prof. Very organized and supplies helpful outlines and notes for each class via WebCT. Awesome!! Take his class!

I would voluntarily take this class again with Fernando as the instructor (as long as it wasn't at 8:30 am again). He is very organized and assignments really help to solidify material covered in lecture. Highly recommended. Best instructor I have had at SFU.
He's great!  I love his teaching style.  He was my prof and TA.  Marking was fair.  What I like best about him is that he actually CARES about his students!  I absolutely recommend him!
